channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Zelenskyy heads to London for more Ukraine peace talks. Here's what to know
item.description: The talks signal fresh support from European allies. But they follow stalled U.S. negotiations in Miami and comments from President Trump's son sugges...

item.title: After Texas ruling, Trump and Republicans head to 2026 with a redistricting edge
item.description: Trump has prompted a redistricting race as he tries to maintain Republican control of the House in the 2026 elections. Democrats have fewer options to...

item.title: How China, not the U.S., became the main climate solution story in 2025
item.description: The U.S. has become a "side character" in the global story of renewable energy, experts say. China dominates the sector, with positive implications fo...

item.title: SCOTUS case could expand presidential powers. And, Dems pitch plan for ACA subsidies
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments today in a case about President Trump's firing of a Federal Trade Commissioner. And, Senate Democrats are set to...

item.title: Republicans push high deductible plans and health savings accounts
item.description: A Republican call to give Americans cash instead of health insurance subsidies revives an old idea that has left millions with medical debt.

item.title: Here's where minimum wage increases are set to kick in next year
item.description: Minimum wages are set to rise in 22 U.S. states and 66 cities and counties next year, even as the federal baseline wage remains at $7.25.

item.title: A second flight of Iranian deportees, carrying 55, has left the US, Iran says
Car bomb kills 5 people, including 3 officers, in front of police station
item.description: The explosion was so powerful that human remains were scattered throughout the area, police said.

item.title: Hitmen ambush and kill journalist who covered corruption
item.description: Fernando Nunezwas shot and killed by hitmen while returning from an assignment and his brother was critically injured, the ANP said.

item.title: Thieves snatch eight Matisse artworks from library in Brazil
item.description: The thieves enter the library in normal opening hours, stuffing the art works into a canvas bag.

item.title: Woman who blackmailed Son Heung-min gets four years in jail
item.description: The woman claiming she was carrying the ex-Tottenham captain's child and extorted $200,000 from him.

item.title: Syrians share their thoughts one year on from the fall of Assad
item.description: The BBC's Middle East correspondent Hugo Bachega speaks to Syrians about how life has changed since the revolution.

item.title: Beshear takes on national role as Dems eye governors to get to the White House
item.description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear is leading the Democratic Governors Association for the 2026 midterms, with fellow potential presidential candidate Michiga...

item.title: Thousands flee Thai-Cambodia border after deadly clashes
item.description: At least five people have been killed in the most serious confrontation between both sides since July.

item.title: One hundred abducted schoolchildren released in Nigeria
item.description: Details of the release of the schoolchildren are still unclear and 165 people remain unaccounted for.

item.title: 11/3: CBS Morning News
item.description: Government shutdown enters Day 34; Affordability and economy top concerns for voters ahead of Election Day.

item.title: Redistricting in Indiana faces ultimate test in state Senate
Records reviewed by AP detail online monitoring, arrests in New Orleans immigration crackdown
item.description: State and federal authorities are monitoring online criticism and protests against the immigration crackdown in New Orleans.
